newsitem.title: USA: Komag says Q4 earnings may be hampered. [CORRECTED 16:28 GMT 4/10]
newsitem.headline: Komag says Q4 earnings may be hampered. [CORRECTED 16:28 GMT 4/10]

text.p: Komag Inc.'s fourth- quarter earnings may be hampered as the computer disk drive component maker switches to a new line of products, the company's chief executive said.
"Our fourth-quarter earnings will be challenging compared to the year-ago results," said Stephen Johnson, Komag chief executive and president.
Komag makes the metallic disks that store computer information. Its customers are the major disk-drive manufacturers.

In the past two quarters, the company has been increasing the manufacturing of a more advanced product lines. The manufacturing process is not as efficient as the older products, said David Allen, Komag treasurer. The inefficiency is cutting into Komag's earnings.

In September, Komag said its third-quarter earnings will be less than expected because of the product transition. Third- quarter net income will be $0.30-$0.50 per share, and sales will be $152.2 million, the company said.
Komag executives would not give more specific estimates for the fourth quarter.
